about.desc: Hi, I am a recent computer science graduate from Boston College.
about.address: 321 Hammond Pond Parkway, Chestnut Hill, MA 02467

news.title: Started working as Teaching Assistant for Computer Systems

projects.title: Movie Review Sentiment Analysis
projects.desc: Movie review sentiment analysis app on django. The model is trained with self-implemented Naive Bayes using data set of 2000 tagged movie reviews. See the about page of the website for more detail.

projects.title: Heart Disease Classifier
projects.desc: Heart disease prediction app on django. The model is trained with sklearn's gaussian naive bayes classifier using heart disease dataset from UCI Machine Learning Repository: https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Heart+Disease. Things to fix in the future: (1) Prevent clicking button with invalid input (2) table too wide (3) initial delay for data to load in modal page.

projects.title: Peer Assessment System
projects.authors: Donghyuk Kim, Richard Yang, Alex Xu, Seunghyun Nam
projects.source: Software Engineering CSCI3356 Course Project, Spring 2020
projects.desc: Full-stack peer assessment management system developed by a team of four seniors. This semester-long project was designed to emulate software engineering process. Professors can create and manage peer evaluations for their classes and students can complete assigned peer evaluations. Notable features include: automatic email reminders, downloadable statistics, etc. See the report for details on all functional requirements that have been fulfilled. [PROFESSOR LOGIN] id: ms@bc.edu | pw: SoftwareEngineering [STUDENT LOGIN] id: mp@bc.edu | pw:47047663

projects.title: Donation Hub - React Website
projects.source: Web App Development CSCI2254 Final Project, Spring 2020
projects.desc: How can we make giving non-monetary donations to organizations more convenient, accessible, and personal for donors? Our blog-style website offers a centralized hub where donors can learn about various local organizations at once. The website was developed using React.

projects.title: Instagram Clone - React Website
projects.source: Web App Development CSCI2254 Assignment, Spring 2020
projects.desc: Replicated design and functionalities of Instagram. Built from scratch using create-react-app.

projects.title: Order Tracking Application
projects.authors: Donghyuk Kim, Yindong Sun, Kevin Li, Rockey Ke
projects.source: Database Systems & Application CSCI2257 Final Project, Fall 2019
projects.desc: Database-oriented web application built with Oracle Application Express. The app mimics functionalities typically found in online shopping carts such as adding items to cart, checking out, validating order, canceling order, viewing status, etc.

projects.title: Speech Analysis of Murderers in TV Show
projects.authors: Donghyuk Kim, Jessica Bolduc, Ashley Oh, Dipesh Patel
projects.source: Natural Language Processing CSCI3349 Final Project, Fall 2019
projects.desc: Can we quantitatively differentiate murderers and non-murderers in TV Show, Crime Scene Investigation, by analyzing their scripts? We utilized several Natural Language Processing techniques such as sentiment analysis, affective, bag of word models to classify characters into murderers and non-murderers using machine learning models.

projects.title: ASL Classification
projects.authors: Donghyuk Kim, Roger Wang, Jay Agrawal, Azim Keshwani, Matthew Kim
projects.source: Machine Learning CSCI3345 Final Project, Fall 2019
projects.desc: We utilized recurrent neural networks to build a model that can classify images of alphabets in American Sign Language.

projects.title: Evil Hangman Game
projects.source: Swift/iOS App Dev ISYS2160 Final Project, Spring 2019
projects.desc: iOS game developed with Swift using Xcode. It is Hangman, but with a catch: you can't win! It uses an algorithm to filter through remaining words and secretly changes the answer as user guesses letters. Easter egg to turn off 'evil' feature available.

projects.title: Snacktacular
projects.source: Swift/iOS App Dev ISYS2160 Assignment, Spring 2019
projects.desc: Final app development assignment from the course. Full-stack yelp-like restaurant review app using Cloud Firestore database, photo sharing, social login, maps, and more.

projects.title: Proof of Hardness: Subset-Sum Problem
projects.source: Computability and Complexity CSCI3390 Final Project, Fall 2018
projects.desc: The paper steps through the proof that the classic subset-sum problem is an NP-COMPLETE problem. Meaning, if there exists an algorithm that can solve subset-sum in polynomial time, P would equal NP. The program in github reduces 3-SAT problem into SUBSET-SUM problem in polynomial time. Github link is to a python program that performs reduction and solves subset sum. The website is a simple HTML/JavaScript visualization of the reduction.
